BACT 1.0.0

Normal distribution for Bayesian Adaptive Trial

Source: R/normalBACT.R
normalBACT.Rd

Simulation for normal distribution for Bayesian Adaptive trial with different inputs to control for power, sample size, type 1 error rate, and etc.

normalBACT(mu_control, sd_control, mu_treatment, sd_treatment, N_total, lambda,
  lambda_time, interim_look, EndofStudy, prior = c(1, 1), block = 2,
  rand_ratio = c(1, 1), prop_loss_to_followup = 0.15, h0 = 0,
  futility_prob = 0.05, expected_success_prob = 0.9, prob_ha = 0.95,
  N_impute = 100, number_mcmc = 1000)

Arguments

mu_control

scalar. Mean of the control group.
sd_control

scalar. Standard deviation of the control group.
mu_treatment

scalar. Mean of the treatment group.
sd_treatment

scalar. Standard deviation of the treatment group.
N_total

scalar. Total sample size
lambda

vector. Lambda for different enrollment rates across times.
lambda_time

vector. Same size as lambda, denote times at lambda changes.
interim_look

vector. Sample size for interim looks, total size not included.
EndofStudy

scalar. Length of the study.
prior

vector. Prior value of beta rate, beta(a0, b0)
block

scalar. Block size for randomization to be implemented.
rand_ratio

vector. Randomization ratio for control to treatment. Integer values mapping the size of the block.
prop_loss_to_followup

scalar. Proportion of loss in follow up.
h0

scalar. treshold for comparing two proportions. default at 0.
futility_prob

scalar. Type 1 error rate.
expected_success_prob

scalar. Power of the study.
prob_ha

scalar. Probability of alternative hypothesis.
N_impute

scalar. Number of imputation for monte carlo simulation for missing data.
number_mcmc

scalar. Number of Monte Carlo Markov Chain in sampling posterior.

Value

a list of output

Examples

normalBACT(mu_control = 10, mu_treatment = 8,
           sd_control = 0.8, sd_treatment = 1.2, N_total = 300,
           lambda = c(0.3, 1), lambda_time = c(25),
           interim_look = c(110, 140, 220, 270),
           EndofStudy = 50)
#> [1] 110
#> [1] 110
#> $prob_ha
#> [1] 0.95
#> 
#> $N_treatment
#> [1] 48
#> 
#> $N_control
#> [1] 47
#> 
#> $N_total
#> [1] 110
#> 
#> $N_max
#> [1] 300
#> 
#> $stop_futility
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $stop_expected_success
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> $prob_ha_final
#> [1] 0.873
#> 
#> $est_final
#> [1] -1.813827
#> 
#> $est_int
#> [1] -2.170093
#> 
#> $MLE_est
#> treatment 
#> -1.834474 
#> 
#> $MLE_est_int
#> treatment 
#> -2.212571 
#> 
#> $mu_treatment
#> [1] 8
#> 
#> $mu_control
#> [1] 10
#> 
#> $sd_treatment
#> [1] 1.2
#> 
#> $sd_control
#> [1] 0.8
#>
